basics.name: Angelica Sofia Valeriani
basics.label: Senior Project Manager PMP® | Financial Services | AI Engineer
basics.summary: Multilingual and results-driven Project Manager with a solid background in digital transformation, stakeholder engagement, and cross-functional leadership. With an academic foundation and early career in AI and Machine Learning, I bring a strong technical perspective to strategic initiatives. Passionate about continuous learning and committed to making a difference, I also serve as an active Red Cross volunteer and coordinator—combining analytical skills with a human-centered approach to drive meaningful, lasting impact.

work.name: Thales Group
work.position: Senior Project Manager | Financial Services & Payments Systems
work.summary: As a Senior Project Manager, I lead complex digital transformation initiatives within the banking and payments sector, managing end-to-end project delivery with a focus on innovation, process optimization, and measurable business impact. I work closely with key clients—including Intesa Sanpaolo, Edenred, Fineco Bank, and Crédit Agricole—ensuring alignment with strategic objectives and enhancing operational efficiency through product integration and emerging technologies.

work.name: Intesa Sanpaolo
work.summary: I worked in the Chief IT Digital Innovation Officer Area within a team managing transformative projects on applications in the Finance and Capital Markets domain to support business operations. The role included contributing to project delivery activities related to Investment Banking and Capital Markets, in collaboration with both internal and external teams. Additionally, I analyzed data and processes using advanced analytics and data visualization techniques, leveraging innovative Data Management and Data Governance tools.
highlights: 2023: Role of Data Tehcnology Owner (Data Governance Management)

work.name: CERN
work.summary: I was awarded a fellowship funded by Crowd4SDG, a Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Action project focused on climate action, gender equality, and the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). During this experience, I applied machine learning and deep learning techniques to automatically analyze large volumes of images and metadata from social media platforms. The work led to the publication of a research paper, and the project was being further developed by a PhD student and Politecnico di Milano research team.
highlights: 2021: Selection of project for challenge of CERN Ideasquare

publications.name: Exploring the runtime performance of knowledge graph embedding methods
publications.publisher: 2021 IEEE 6th International Forum on Research and Technology for Society and Industry (RTSI), pages 463–468, 2021
publications.summary: The work is a performance-focused evaluation of Knowledge Graph Embedding (KGE) models, introducing KGE-Perf, a framework for benchmarking memory and runtime efficiency. It highlights the impact of optimization strategies and shows GPU as the most effective architecture.

publications.name: Poli4sdg: An application for environmental crises management and gender support.
publications.publisher: International Journal of Computer and Information Engineering, 17(1):78–83, 2023
publications.summary: This work presents POLI4SDG, a web and mobile prototype developed within the CROWD4SDG initiative to support SDG 13 (Climate Action). The application helps users access emergency services during environmental crises, integrating citizen science contributions and promoting inclusivity, particularly for vulnerable groups such as women.

publications.name: Teaching a Learner Driver using Reinforcement Learning and Planning Strategies
publications.summary: This work explores the application of Teacher-Student Reinforcement Learning in autonomous driving, focusing on racing scenarios. It investigates how a teacher can accelerate the learning process by providing guidance through planning-based optimal trajectories, both in offline and online settings.

projects.name: Crowd4SDG
projects.summary: Crowd4SDG is a Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Action supported by the European Commission’s Science with and for Society (SwafS) programme and sponsored by CERN IdeaSquare with the partnership of key players in AI, Sustainability and Engineering.

projects.name: KGE-Perf
projects.summary: This project investigates how different KGE algorithms behave in terms of memory and speed across diverse hardware setups. The goal is to bridge the gap between research and real-world applicability, offering insights for scalable, efficient deployments.
